title: SVGExamples

metadata.description: Learn about SVGExamples with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Try-it Yourself Examples
The examples below embed the SVG code directly into the HTML code.
SVG is supported in all major browsera.
SVG Rectangle
Rectangle with the six basic attributes and a fill color
Rectangle with fill and stroke
Rectangle with opacity
Rectangle with opacity 2
Rectangle with rounded corners
Examples explained
SVG Circle
A circle
A circle with border
A circle with opacity
Examples explained
SVG Ellipse
An ellipse
Three ellipses on top of each other
Two ellipses
Examples explained
SVG Line
A line
A thick horizontal line
A thick vertical line
Examples explained
SVG Polygon
A polygon with three sides
A polygon with four sides
A polygon with six sides
A star
Another star
Examples explained
SVG Polyline
A polyline
Another polyline
Examples explained
SVG Path
A path
A quadratic Bézier curve
Examples explained
SVG Text
Write a simple text with SVG
A text with no fill
A text with fill and stroke
Rotate each letter of text with the rotate attribute
Rotate the whole text with the transform attribute
Use of the <tspan> element inside the <text> element
Examples explained
SVG textPath
Text along a path with <textPath> element
Text along a path with <textPath> element and textLength attribute
Examples explained
SVG Links
Text as a link
Graphic as a link
Examples explained
SVG Images
Insert an image
Show an image on top of a circle, and add a text under the image
Examples explained
SVG Markers
A line with a start marker and an end marker
A polyline with a start marker, a mid marker and an end marker
Examples explained
SVG Fill
Use the fill attribute to set the fill color of graphics
Use the fill-opacity attribute to set opacity for fill color
Use the fill-rule attribute for a polygon, with value "evenodd"
Use the fill-rule attribute for a polygon, with value "nonzero"
Examples explained
SVG Stroke
Use the stroke attribute to set the outline color of graphics
Use the stroke attribute to set the colors of lines
Use the stroke-width attribute to set the width of the outline
Use the stroke-width attribute to set the width of lines
Use the stroke-opacity attribute to set the opacity of the outline
Use the stroke-opacity attribute to set the opacity of lines
Use the stroke-linecap attribute to set different endings for lines
Use the stroke-dasharray attribute to create dashed lines
Use the stroke-dasharray attribute to create dashed outlines
Use the stroke-linejoin attribute to create different corner shapes
Examples explained
SVG Filters Intro
Use the <feGaussianBlur> filter to blur an SVG graphic
Examples explained
SVG Filters Blur Effect
Use the <feGaussianBlur> filter to create a blur effect
Use the stdDeviation attribute to set the amount of the blur
Examples explained
SVG Filters Drop Shadow 1
Use the <feDropShadow> filter to create a drop shadow effect
Examples explained
SVG Filters Drop Shadow 2
Offset a rectangle, then blend the original on top of the offset image
Blur the offset image
Make the shadow black
Treat the shadow as a color matrix
A feBlend filter
Filter 1
Filter 2
Filter 3
Filter 4
Filter 5
Filter 6
Examples explained
SVG Linear Gradients
A horizontal linear gradient with two colors
A horizontal linear gradient with three colors
A vertical linear gradient with two colors
A horizontal linear gradient with text
An angular linear gradient with two colors
Examples explained
SVG Radial Gradients
A radial gradient with two colors
A radial gradient with three colors
A radial gradient with cx and cy to 25%
A radial gradient with spreadMethod="reflect"
A radial gradient with spreadMethod="repeat"
A radial gradient with two colors and stop-opacity
Examples explained
SVG Patterns
Create a rectangle filled with small circles
Create a rectangle filled with small lightblue rectangles and gradient circles
Examples explained
SVG Transformations
Translate() function: Move an object horizontally
Translate() function: Move an object vertically
Translate() function: Move an object horizontally and vertically
Scale() function: Scale an object
Scale() function:  Scale an object vertically
Scale() function:  Scale an object horizontally
Rotate() function: Rotate an object by a degree
SkewX() function: Skew an object along the x axis by a degree
SkewY() function: Skew an object along the y axis by a degree
Examples explained
SVG Clipping and Masking
<clipPath>: Remove a part from an element
<mask>: Apply a rectangular mask to an element
<mask>: Apply a circular mask to an element
<mask>: Fill color and opacity
<mask>: Gradients in mask
Examples explained
SVG Animation
<set>: Sets the value of an attribute for a specified duration
<animate>: Animates an attribute of an element
<animate>: with freeze
<animateTransform>: Animates the transform attribute on the target element
<animateMotion>: Sets how an element moves along a motion path
Examples explained
SVG Scripting
Change attribute value with JavaScript
Change CSS with JavaScript
Change attribute value and CSS with JavaScript
Animate element with JavaScript
Examples explained
SVG Misc
Rectangle that repeatedly fade away over 5 seconds
A growing rectangle that will change color
Three rectangles that will change color
Move text along a motion path
Move, rotate, and scale text along a motion path
Move, rotate, and scale text along a motion path + a growing rectangle that will change color
Rotating ellipses

★
+1

practice_exercises.title: Create a Layout
practice_exercises.description: Build a simple layout using the techniques from this tutorial.

related_topics.title: C Common Pitfalls and How to Avoid Them

quiz.question: What is SVG?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of SVG is 'supported in all major browsera'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this javascript feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers SVGExamples concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SVGExamples effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SVGExamples and how to apply it in your projects.
